title: Apert Syndrome: Epidemiology and Demographics
short_description: Clinical document detailing the incidence, demographics, and historical reporting of Apert syndrome.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological data on Apert syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. The document outlines the estimated birth incidence rate of approximately 1 in 65,000 births, discusses the equal distribution between males and females, and notes the historical documentation of over 300 cases since the condition was first described in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The document also highlights demographic variations, specifically noting higher incidence rates among Asian populations.
